author: daxian-dbw
body:
.NET 5 now [support COM objects using `IEnumerator` (`IEnumVARIANT`)](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/pull/37326) (the fix will be in .NET 5 preview 7), so our code, the `ComEnumerator`, that handles `IEnumVARIANT` can be removed once we move to .NET 5 preview 7.

This is a follow-up to https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/pull/11795

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body:
:tada:This issue was addressed in #13259, which has now been successfully released as `v7.1.0-preview.6`.:tada:

Handy links:
* [Release Notes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/tag/v7.1.0-preview.6)

title: Remove the 'ComEnumerator' code as the support is now in .NET 5
